animal.pig:
Name: Pig (Latin: Sus domesticus), often called swine or hog.
Length: 0.9 -1.8m Weight: 50 - 350kg adults Eats: Omnivore, eats both animals and plants Usage for humans: Produces meat called pork History: Been around since as early as 13,000â€“12,700 BC. Mostly used for meat, and there hides for shields, bones for tools and bristles for brushes.
animal.horse: Name: Horse (Latin: Equus ferus caballus) Length: 0.9 -1.8m Height: 140-160 cm Weight: 380 - 550kg adults Eats: Plants Usage for humans: Some species used in sports, others produces meat. History: Been domesticated since 4000 BC. Big impact on our history, used as transportation and very suitable for slow heavy work.
